This report summarizes the findings of the Traffic Impact Analysis (TIA) that was performed for
the proposed Legends of Chancellorsville neighborhood in Spotsylvania County, Virginia. The
purpose of this study is to determine the potential impacts to the surrounding transportation system
caused by the traffic generated by the proposed neighborhood.
The proposed neighborhood is located north of Route 3 (Plank Road) between Black Meadow
Road and Elys Ford Road in Spotsylvania County, Virginia. At build-out, the neighborhood is
expected to consist of up to 218 single family homes, and is anticipated to be complete in 2018.
Based on discussion with the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT), a build-out year of
2020 was used in this study to be conservative.
The neighborhood consists of two sections that are separated by a wetland area, so each section
will have a dedicated subdivision entrance. A pedestrian and bike connection between the two
sections might be constructed, but vehicle cross-access will not be provided. The “West Parcel”
will consist of up to 179 homes with one proposed full-movement median break on Route 3
approximately 1,750 feet east of Black Meadow Road and 1,450 feet west of the next median
break to the east. A stub-out connection to Battlefield Drive might be made, which would provide
access to Black Meadow Road, but to be conservative, it was assumed that all of the trips in and
out of the West Parcel will occur at the proposed median break on Route 3. The “East Parcel” will
consist of up to 39 homes with one proposed full-movement connection to Elys Ford Road.

text.i: Traffic Impact Analysis Legends of Chancellorsville – Spotsylvania County, VA

page.text: Based on our TIA scoping meeting with the County and VDOT on November 5, the weekday AM
and PM peak hours were studied for the following intersections:
 Route 3 (Plank Road) at Route 621 (Orange Plank Road)
 Route 3 (Plank Road) at Route 610 (Elys Ford Road)
 Route 610 (Elys Ford Road) at Site Drive 2

Based on the traffic capacity analysis, all of the study intersections are expected to operate at an
acceptable overall level-of-service at build-out of the neighborhood with the following

 Construct a westbound U-turn lane on Route 3 with 100 feet of storage

 Construct the subdivision entrance with one ingress lane and two egress lanes

text.i: Traffic Impact Analysis Legends of Chancellorsville – Spotsylvania County, VA

page.text: The proposed neighborhood is located north of Route 3 between Black Meadow Road and Elys
Ford Road in Spotsylvania County, Virginia. Figure 1 shows the site location map. Based on the
TIA scoping meeting with the County and VDOT, the study area consists of the following
 Route 3 (Plank Road) at Route 621 (Orange Plank Road)
 Route 3 (Plank Road) at Route 610 (Elys Ford Road)
 Route 610 (Elys Ford Road) at Site Drive 2
The property is currently zoned RU (Rural), and is proposed to be rezoned as PRR-3 (Planned
At build-out, the proposed neighborhood is expected to consist of up to 218 single family homes,
which are anticipated to be complete by 2018. Figure 1 shows the site location aerial map.
The neighborhood consists of two sections that are separated by a wetland area, so each section
will have a dedicated subdivision entrance. A pedestrian and bike connection between the two
sections might be constructed, but vehicle cross-access will not be provided. The “West Parcel”
will consist of up to 179 homes with one proposed full-movement median break on Route 3
approximately 1,750 feet east of Black Meadow Road and 1,450 feet west of the next median
break to the east. A stub-out connection to Battlefield Drive might be made, which would provide
access to Black Meadow Road, but to be conservative, it was assumed that all of the trips in and
out of the West Parcel will occur at the proposed median break on Route 3. The “East Parcel” will
consist of up to 39 homes with one proposed full-movement connection to Elys Ford Road.

text.i: Traffic Impact Analysis Legends of Chancellorsville – Spotsylvania County, VA

page.text: The traffic capacity analysis was performed with Synchro 8 (Build 804, Rev. 795), which is a
comprehensive software package that allows the user to determine the level-of-service (LOS) for
the study intersections based on the control delay thresholds specified in the 2010 Highway
Capacity Manual (HCM). LOS is a qualitative measure of traffic operation that ranges from LOS
A, which represents free-flow conditions, to LOS F, which represents congestion and long delays.
For signalized intersections, Synchro calculates the average control delay and queue length for
each lane group, and the LOS for the overall intersection. For unsignalized intersections, Synchro
calculates the average control delay and queue length for stop-controlled movements, but does not
provide an overall LOS for the intersection. Table 1 shows the control delay thresholds for

text.b: Highway Capacity Manual – Levels-of-Service and Delay

page.text: LOS D is typically an acceptable overall LOS for signalized intersections, and it is common for
left-turn and minor street movements to experience LOS E or F at both signalized and unsignalized

text.i: Traffic Impact Analysis Legends of Chancellorsville – Spotsylvania County, VA

page.text: Existing lane configurations, storage lengths, and traffic signal timing information was collected in
the field by Ramey Kemp & Associates, Inc. (RKA). The AM peak hour (7:00 to 9:00 AM) and
PM peak hour (4:00 to 6:00 PM) turning movement counts were conducted at the following
intersection on Tuesday, November 12 and Wednesday, November 13:
Traffic volumes at the intersection of Route 3 at Elys Ford Road were provided by VDOT. The
counts were conducted in September 2013 for both the AM peak hour (7:00 – 9:00 AM) and the
Additionally, a tube count was conducted on November 12 and 13 by RKA on Elys Ford Road at
the approximate location of the future subdivision entrance to evaluate turn lane warrants.
Figure 4 shows the existing AM and PM peak hour volumes at the study intersections, and the
count data are provided in the Appendix. Note that the peak hour traffic volumes were adjusted up
slightly as necessary to balance the volumes between intersections where appropriate.

text.b: Analysis of Existing (2013) Peak Hour Traffic Conditions

page.text: The existing (2013) weekday AM and PM peak hour traffic volumes at the study intersection were
analyzed to determine the current LOS under existing roadway conditions. The results of the
analysis are presented in Section 8 of this report.

page.text: In order to account for the growth of traffic and subsequent traffic conditions at a future year, no-
build traffic projections are needed. No-build traffic includes traffic due to the growth of the
community and surrounding area that is anticipated to occur regardless of whether the proposed
Based on historical ADT data provided by VDOT, an annual growth rate of 2.0% per year was
applied to all traffic volumes to project existing traffic volumes to the future analysis year of 2020.
Based on discussion with the County and VDOT, there are no approved developments in the
vicinity of the site that will generate a significant amount of traffic.
The no-build (2020) peak hour traffic volumes were estimated by growing the existing 2013 traffic
volumes for seven years to 2020 using an annual growth rate of 2.0%. Figure 5 shows the
projected no-build (2020) peak hour traffic volumes.

text.b: Analysis of No-build (2020) Peak Hour Traffic Conditions

page.text: No-build (2020) conditions were analyzed with existing lane configurations and traffic control.

page.text: At build-out, the proposed neighborhood is expected to consist of up to 218 single family homes.
The trip generation potential for the West Parcel and East Parcel was estimated separately because
each will have a dedicated access point with no vehicle cross-access. Average weekday daily and
peak hour trips were calculated based on the Institute of Transportation Engineers (ITE) Trip
Edition. Table 2 presents a summary of the trip generation calculations for
the West Parcel, and Table 3 presents a summary of the trip generation calculations for the East
No adjustments for internal capture or pass-by trips were made in this study.

text.i: Traffic Impact Analysis Legends of Chancellorsville – Spotsylvania County, VA

page.text: The signalized intersection of Route 3 at Orange Plank Road was analyzed under all traffic
conditions. Table 4 presents a summary of the capacity analysis results, and the Synchro output is

text.b: Analysis Summary of Route 3 at Orange Plank Road

page.text: The signalized intersection of Route 3 at Orange Plank Road currently operates at LOS B during
the AM peak hour and at LOS A during the PM peak hour. Under no-build and build traffic
conditions, the overall intersection is expected to operate at LOS C during the AM peak hour and
at LOS A during the PM peak hour, with all lane groups operating at LOS D or better. No
improvements are recommended at this intersection.

text.i: Traffic Impact Analysis Legends of Chancellorsville – Spotsylvania County, VA

page.text: The signalized intersection of Route 3 at Elys Ford Road was analyzed under all traffic conditions.
Table 5 presents a summary of the capacity analysis results, and the Synchro output is included in

text.b: Analysis Summary of Route 3 at Elys Ford Road

page.text: The signalized intersection of Route 3 at Elys Ford Road currently operates at LOS D during the
AM peak hour and at LOS C during the PM peak hour. Under no-build and build traffic
conditions, the intersection is expected to operate at LOS D during both the AM and PM peak
The Elys Ford Road approaches are projected to operate at LOS F under the no-build and build
traffic conditions, but widening is not feasible because that would require right-of-way acquisition
from the Chancellorsville Battlefield National Park. No improvements are recommended at this

Capacity analysis indicates that the southbound left-turn movement is expected to operate with

The projected peak hour traffic volumes were compared to the VDOT turn lane warrants found in
Appendix F of the Access Management Design Standards for Entrances and Intersections, and the
following turn lanes are recommended at the proposed median break on Route 3:
 Construct an eastbound left turn lane on Route 3 with 200 feet of storage
 Construct a westbound right turn lane on Route 3 with 200 feet of storage
The VDOT turn lane warrant diagrams are included in the Appendix.

text.i: Traffic Impact Analysis Legends of Chancellorsville – Spotsylvania County, VA

page.text: Based on the traffic capacity analysis, the following roadway improvements are recommended to
accommodate the traffic generated by the proposed neighborhood:
 No improvements are recommended at this intersection
 No improvements are recommended at this intersection
 Construct a full-movement median break on Route 3
 Construct an eastbound left turn lane on Route 3 with 200 feet of storage
 Construct a westbound U-turn lane on Route 3 with 100 feet of storage
 Construct a westbound right turn lane on Route 3 with 200 feet of storage
 Construct the subdivision entrance with one ingress lane and two egress lanes
Elys Ford Road at Site Driveway 2:
 Construct the subdivision entrance with one ingress lane and at least one egress lane

It is important for the applicant to provide sufficient information to county and VDOT staff so that questions regarding
geographic scope, alternate methodology, or other issues can be answered at the scoping meeting.
The applicant is responsible for entering the relevant information and submitting the form to VDOT and the
locality no less than three (3) business days prior to the meeting. If a form is not received by this deadline,
the scope of work meeting may be postponed.
Ramey Kemp & Associates, Inc. - Carl Hultgren, P.E., PTOE
The proposed neighborhood will consist of 200 single family homes east of Black
Meadow Road, with one new median break on Route 3 approximately 1,750 feet
east of Black Meadow Road. The proposed neighborhood also includes 56 single
family homes on Ely's Ford Road in the northeast portion of the property, with one
full-movement connection to Ely's Ford Road.
It is important for the applicant to provide sufficient information to county and VDOT staff so that questions regarding
geographic scope, alternate methodology, or other issues can be answered at the scoping meeting.

westbound U-turn lane in the median. We will also evaluate turn lane warrants on

Appropriate Radius required at all Intersections and Entrances (Commercial or Private).
PHV- - Peak Hour Volume (also Design Hourly Volume equivalent)
If PHV is not known use formula: PHV = ADT x K x D
K = the percent of AADT occurring in the peak hour
D = the percent of traffic in the peak direction of flow
Note: An average of 11% for K x D will suffice.
